articles.author: Jeff Gammage
articles.title: Institutions must offer more than words when they occupy Native American land, Indigenous people say - The Philadelphia Inquirer
articles.description: Indigenous leaders and activists weigh in on the land acknowledgements now popular among cultural institutions. They all say it's only the first step.
articles.content:
The lands of Ann Remys Lenni-Lenape ancestors once spanned from New York to Delaware, covering all of the Philadelphia region and the whole of New Jersey.
No longer, of course. The land was taken an… [+7053 chars]
